clinical_study.brief_title: Using Virtual Reality to Prevent Pre-operative Anxiety in Ambulatory Surgery Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Hypnosis Mask in Pre-operative Anxiety Management in Ambulatory Surgery Patients: Using Virtual Reality

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to evaluate the impact on pre-operative anxiety management of using the virtual reality mask for surgery of hallux valgus.

primary_outcome.description: The State Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) will be used to measure anxiety levels.
The State Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) will be used to measure anxiety levels.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of study, an average of 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Dose of analgesic taken will be added up.

secondary_outcome.description: Duration of stay before discharge of hospital.
EVA score, a french auto evaluation tool will be used for pain.

arm_group.description: Mask-wearing as hypnosis method for patients in this arm.
No hypnosis for patients in this arm.

intervention.description: Virtual mask will be worn by patients before and during surgery of Hallux valgus to realize hypnosis. Virtual mask with 2 types of voice: female voice and male voice. Several types of image or music to choice by patient.
No hypnosis during surgery of Hallux valgus.
